nodes.bodyText: I'd think that we can remove the Math.max(...) for this class - a value on it's own can very well be negative! If the event wants to provide this guarantee it can wrap a ModifiableValue and perform that operation.

I'm not sure we should offer this setter to change all modifiers at once, basically overriding everything someone else did 🤔  Depending on whether we want this to be mutable or immutable we may offer a clear() method to reset all modifier lists, though.

I'm also not sure whether we should expose this detail to the outside - what use cases are there where it would help a consumer to know whether a modifier of +4 is because of [1, 3], [4], or [-2, 3, 0, 3] (or any other combination...)
TODO: move this to TFloatList ^^
Method was removed and the modifiers were changed in place as they were added.

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't the multipliers also multiply the baseValue (i.e. (baseValue + modifiers.sum()) * product(multipliers) ...)?
obviously yes 🙈
Yep silly mistake, have fixed.
This formula should be updated to match the actual value: result = (<baseValue> + Σ <modifier>) * Σ <multiplier> + Σ <postModifier>
Have changed the multiplers to compound now as per the formula
The rest of the formula in the comment still needs changing though: result = (<baseValue> + Σ <modifier>) * Π <multiplier> + Σ <postModifier>

I'd like to have some JavaDoc here (or some documentation somewhere else) on how the ModifiableValue is actually persisted. What is the format to specify a modifiable in a prefab?
From looking at the code it seems like the value is persisted as "unlabeled" array:
"<field_name>": [<base_value>, <pre_modifier>, <multiplier>, <post_modifier>]

I don't think this is very intuitive, and when seeing this in a prefab I'd think of a vector or list but not of a special data class 🙈
Added Javadocs, the default way to specify in prefabs is with a single value only and then the modifiers are given default values.

I'm wondering whether it would make sense to check an else if here for a single number. That would allow to easily specify the base value in a prefab without worrying about all the modifiers. So you could either do
"myValue": 7,					// base value only
// ... or ...
"otherValaue": [3, 0, 0.9, 2]	// base and modifiers/multiplier

This is handled by default as the constructor takes the base value and assigns default modifiers. The single value specified in the prefabs is deserialized into the constructor for ModifiableValue which takes only the base value. Other modifiers can be set optionally
Shouldn't this check that the size is actually exactly 4? Otherwise, floatList.get(n) would fail...

Since the size can only be 1(when deserializing the prefabs) or 4(on a game load after a seed has been harvested), this would not cause any problems. However, this seems like the right thing to do in general. Have made the change.
I'd say these methods should have JavaDoc to encourage usage of the preAdd, postAdd, and multiply instead of overriding the respective value.
